column3: objective

Migrate to Cisco next-gen firewalls. Our firewall architecture defines the boundary between our private Scripps network and the internet. They prevent public access to all of our critical services (e.g., Epic) and data.
End of Life and support for Checkpoint FW.
Eliminate throughput bottlenecks by migrating Splunk forwarding architecture from Windows to Linux.
Defend active directory against authentication attacks and privilege-escalation attacks.
Prevent uanauthorized use of USB drives on managed devices.
Develop a program to assess MITRE coverage by emulating adversary tactics in a controlled environment.
Onboard logsources that map to desired MITRE use cases.
Build and transition to a Linux-based eent forwarding architecture that eliminates the bottlenecks associated with ther Windows-based architecture.
Integrate our SNOW with our network managed services SNOW such that there is a single work driver, single source of truth, and single point of data entry for all firewall work.
Build additional infrastructure necessary to complete the Umbrella implementation such that cybersecurity features and log fidelity are maximized.
Build a data labeling schema based on existing policy and deploy it such that information at rest is automatically classified where possible, manually classifiable where not.
Build policies that restrict data in motion based on data label.

column2: Privileged Access Management - Account Disco Inventory
column3: Define the scope of accounts to be treated as elevated. Build a process to discover elevated accounts, create an inventory, and maintain it.

column2: Privileged Access Management - CyberArk Administrative Account Vaulting
column3: Onboard all elevated individual accounts associated with a human into CyberArk. Protect with a checkout process guarded by MFA.

column2: Privileged Access Management - Service Account Proxy
column3: Onboard all service accounts into CyberArk and proxy service account connections through CyberArk.

column2: Privileged Access Management - Local Admin Minimization
column3: Rationalize the population of local admin accounts and reduce the number. Manage the remainder with PAM toolset.
Separate administrative accounts from daily use accounts. Provision daily use accounts such that they are not elevated. Provision administrative accounts such that they do not have mailboxes.

column2: Privileged Access Management - Privileged Access Workstations
column3: Provision dedicated admin workstations from which all administrative activities shall be performed. Adjust monitoring posture with this in mind.

column2: Privileged Access Management - AD Attack Path Modelling
column3: Build the capability and recurring process to model attack paths to elevated domain privileges.

column2: Privileged Access Management - AD Privileged Account Inventory
column3: Build an inventory and a process to ensure that it is maintained completely, accurately, timely.
Deploy and support host-based microsegmentation to control communications on in-scope assets.
Deploy and support a secure vendor VPN solution to the specifications documented in the design phase. Onboard vendors.
